children.subject: Campus changed it's mind.  The note posted above is now what they plan on doing. Sometimes central campus listens and acts in response to feedback. That's a good thing.

I'm close to certain that calcentral will not contact the instructors.  One important reason to contact instructors is to make sure that if there is a conflicting final exam that it will be possible somehow to take both exams by one instructor offering an alternate exam, for example.  If the lectures that conflict are at the exact same time then you can be sure the exam's will conflict.  If they only overlap then at this point, nobody knows if they conflict because campus has not input exam groups into the new system.

Should we email professors about taking conflicting courses before we try to register for them and fill out the online request form or will the system handle contacting them? I want to take CS168 and EE 16A, but if the system will contact the professors for me before it lets me enroll, I don't want to send out unnecessary emails.

history.content:
I received an email today from the SIS team regarding enrollment for next semester, and it linked to the following page: http://sis.berkeley.edu/student/enrollment. I read through the info, and it seems a though there has been misleading information going around regarding enrolling in classes with a time conflict. The webpage says the following: 

  • Enrollment Time Conflict Process
    Beginning with fall semester 2016, you will no longer be able to automatically enroll in two classes that meet at the same time. If you try to enroll in two classes that have a time schedule overlap, CalCentral will alert you at the point of enrollment and give you an opportunity to submit an online request to enroll in both classes. It will take approximately one business day to process request forms. If no other restrictions prevent you from enrolling in both classes, your time conflict restriction will be waived and your enrollment will be processed.

  • Waitlist Time Conflict Process
    If you try to waitlist for a fall semester 2016 class that has a time schedule overlap with another class for which you have enrolled or waitlisted, CalCentral will alert you at the point of processing and give you an opportunity to submit an online request. If a waitlist seat is available and you have no other restrictions, the waitlist request will be processed. It will take approximately one business day to process request forms.

People seem to think it will be impossible to enroll in classes with a time conflict, when it fact it seems as though you can submit an online request at the time of registration to take both classes at the same time (although it takes a day to process). Perhaps I'm just the one who's been misunderstanding what has been said, but I figured I'd make a note here in case anyone else misunderstood as well. I know a lot of people are looking to take classes with time conflicts.
history.subject: Enrolling In Classes With Time Conflicts: Misleading Information
